Basic Qualifications


 * Someone who is a great team player and genuinely believes in solving challenges as a team
 * Someone who believes in exploring alternatives and quickly build prototyping to validate ideas and help iterate concepts
 * Someone who understands and believes in the core tenets of agile both in letter and spirit
 * 5 or more years of experience with developing modular, test first Angular, React or Vue applications
 * 3 or more years of experience working with Postgres, MySQL or MongoDB.
 * 5 or more years of solid hands-on experience building Node.JS applications.
 * 3 or more years of hands-on experience in using modern build tool chains and package managers (webpack, gulp, grunt, npm etc.)
 * Experience testing tools and frameworks like Jasmine, Protractor or similar.
 * Experience developing modern responsive web applications with HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, LESS, SASS, etc.
 * 2 or more years of experience working in agile environments with tools like Jira, Git, and Confluence.
 * Candidates with proven certifications and socially available profiles that demonstrate the body of work and participation in modern collaboration hubs.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Can demonstrate proficiency with Node JS eco-system
 * Can demonstrate proficiency with automated test tools
 * Can demonstrate proficiency with module Angular, React or Vue applications.
   
   

Public Trust Clearance

This role requires the hired candidate to go through public clearance. A minimum of 3 years of stay in the U.S. within the last 5 years is a must to be eligible to qualify for public trust clearance sponsorship.

Benefits And Perks


 *     65%-75% company sponsored (including dependents) premiums towards Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance. 100% employer sponsored STD, LTD & Life Insurance (min $100K). Voluntary Life insurance option available.
 *     Retirement 401(k) Plan with employer matching. Immediate vesting.
 *     Vacation & Sick leaves
 *     Discretionary Bonus, Spot awards, Gifts, Tenure based rewards.
 *     Company sponsored role based certifications/trainings.
 *     Monthly DoordashDashPass subscription.
 *     Group discounts via LifeMart ADP
   
   

Work Location

We do have great open collaboration physical office spaces in Leesburg VA and Baltimore MD for those of us that may prefer either short term or long-term physical spaces. However, Softrams is a 100% remote first team environment, and this role is a 100% remote opportunity within USA . Softrams works in eastern zone and standard work hours are 9 AM ET to 5 PM ET with flexibility around the start and end times based on the team needs.

About Softrams

Softrams is a Maryland & Virginia-based small business information technology, consulting, and solutions provider specializing in emerging technologies for UX/UI, Mobile Apps, DevOps, Big Data Analytics, Data Science, and Cyber Security. We offer innovative technology implementations and build customer-centric services that are simple, intuitive, scalable, efficient and most importantly usable.

Softrams is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, nation origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.
title: Senior Full Stack Developer

description:
Are you passionate about technical leadership and building services for entire enterprises? Then look no further, GEICO is seeking an experienced Principal Engineer to build a Data analytics platform to optimize infrastructure usage across the company. In this role, you will lead an engineering effort to build highly scalable and real time decision platform for consumers to analyze, evaluate, strategize infrastructure usage, and recommend best offerings to manage application workloads with optimized utilization. This is an opportunity to offer state of the art experience to end users through operational excellence.




Our Principal Engineer works with our Distinguished engineer and Sr. engineers to innovate and build new systems, improve, and enhance existing systems as well as identify new opportunities to apply your knowledge to solve critical problems. You will lead Strategy and Execution of a technical roadmap that will increase the velocity of delivering products and unlock new engineering capabilities. The ideal candidate has deep technical expertise in building data analytics platforms, preferably using Open-Source technologies.




Position Responsibilities




As a Principal Engineer, you will:




 * Collaborate with product managers, team members, customers, and other engineering teams to solve our toughest problems.
 * Develop and execute technical software development strategy for the data analytics platform covering security, ingestion practices, real time decisioning & visualization.
 * Accountable for the quality, usability & performance of the solutions.
 * Deep hands-on experience in complex system design and data pipeline and architectures, scale and performance, tuning, with good knowledge on Docker and Kubernetes.
 * Fluent at least two OOP languages among Java, Go, python, C++, etc.
 * Good knowledge of two of the following languages: C, PHP, Perl, Ruby, JavaScript, shell script, etc.
 * Understanding open-source databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc., familiar with No-SQL databases like Cassandra, MongoDB, Elasticsearch; knowledge with NewSQL database like TIDB, Cockroach or YugabyteDB will be a plus.
 * Be a role model and mentor, helping to coach and strengthen the technical expertise and knowledge of our engineering and product community. Influence and educate executives.
 * Consistently share best practices and improve processes within and across teams.
 * Analyze cost and forecast, incorporating them into business plans.
 * Determine and support resource requirements, evaluate operational processes, measure outcomes to ensure desired results, demonstrate adaptability and sponsor continuous learning.
 * Willing to take on-call and operational support.




Qualifications:




 * Exemplary ability to design, perform experiments, and influence engineering direction and product roadmap.
 * Experience partnering with engineering teams and transferring research to production.
 * Track-record of publications history in credible conferences and journals.
 * Practical knowledge of working in Agile environment (Scrum/Kanban/SAFe).
 * Experience with continuous delivery and infrastructure as code.
 * In-depth knowledge of CS data structures and algorithms.
 * Experience solving analytical problems with quantitative approaches.
 * Ability to excel in a fast-paced, startup-like environment.
 * Knowledge of developer tooling across the software development life cycle (task management, source code, building, deployment, test automation and related tools, operations, real-time communication).
 * Experience on open-source database platforms with emphasis on building enterprise scale RDMS and NoSQL platforms
 * Knowledge in big data and streaming data architecture (Lambda/Kappa), K8 cluster and ETL pipeline
 * Knowledge in ML and AI technologies
 * Experience in CI/CD pipeline and related open-source tools like GIT/Jenkin/CircleCI/SonarQube knowledge in Terraform/Ansible will be big plus
 * Knowledge on Open-source monitoring software like Grafana and Prometheus




Experience:




 * 6+ years of professional software development experience
 * 3+ years of experience with architecture and design
 * 4+ years of experience in open-source frameworks
 * 3+ years of experience with AWS, GCP, Azure, or another cloud service
 * 1+ years of people management experience




Education:




 * Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems, or equivalent education or work experience




Benefits:




At GEICO, we make sure you have the support and resources to leverage and develop your skills, secure your financial future, and take care of your health and well-being. GEICO continually seeks to provide a workplace where everyone can be their authentic self. To help achieve this goal, we support associate-led Employee Resource Groups that foster a true sense of community. Through GEICO’s competitive benefits offerings and various training and development opportunities, we have you covered with our Total Rewards Program* that includes:




Premier Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance with no waiting period**




Paid Vacation, Sick and Parental Leave




401(k) Plan




Tuition Reimbursement




Paid Training and Licensures




 * Benefits may be different by location. Benefit eligibility requirements vary and may include length of service.
 * Coverage begins on the date of hire. Must enroll in New Hire Benefits within 30 days of the date of hire for coverage to take effect.




GEICO is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to cultivating an environment where equal employment opportunities are available to all associates and job applicants regardless of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, familial status, disability or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law. GEICO celebrates diversity and believes it is critical to our success. As such, we are committed to recruit, develop and retain the most talented individuals to join our team.




#DICE




Annual Salary




$100,000.00 - $204,500.00




The above annual salary range is a general guideline. Multiple factors are taken into consideration to arrive at the final hourly rate/ annual salary to be offered to the selected candidate. Factors include, but are not limited to, the scope and responsibilities of the role, the selected candidate’s work experience, education and training, the work location as well as market and business considerations.




GEICO will consider sponsoring a new qualified applicant for employment authorization for this position.




Benefits:




As an Associate, you’ll enjoy our Total Rewards Program* to help secure your financial future and preserve your health and well-being, including:




 * Premier Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance with no waiting period**
 * Paid Vacation, Sick and Parental Leave
 * 401(k) Plan
 * Tuition Reimbursement
 * Paid Training and Licensures
 * Benefits may be different by location. Benefit eligibility requirements vary and may include length of service.
 * Coverage begins on the date of hire. Must enroll in New Hire Benefits within 30 days of the date of hire for coverage to take effect.




The equal employment opportunity policy of the GEICO Companies provides for a fair and equal employment opportunity for all associates and job applicants regardless of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, familial status, disability or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law. GEICO hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the job to be filled.




GEICO reasonably accommodates qualified individuals with disabilities to enable them to receive equal employment opportunity and/or perform the essential functions of the job, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship to the Company. This applies to all applicants and associates. GEICO also provides a work environment in which each associate is able to be productive and work to the best of their ability. We do not condone or tolerate an atmosphere of intimidation or harassment. We expect and require the cooperation of all associates in maintaining an atmosphere free from discrimination and harassment with mutual respect by and for all associates and applicants.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer

description:
Job Description

Our client is seeking a Full Stack Engineer with experience in Serverless Technologies, React and AWS to join their rapidly growing startup in the Insurtech industry. The primary duties for this position will initially center on front-end tasks but will expand to encompass full-stack responsibilities.

Their focus is utilizing cutting-edge artificial intelligence to revolutionize the way our clients handle injury claims, driving efficiency, accuracy, and customer satisfaction. Join our talented team and be at the forefront of technological innovation while shaping the future of insurance.

Key Responsibilities


 * Build and lead significant scale projects running in the cloud
 * Collaborate with a cross-functional team of highly skilled professionals to design, develop, and implement state-of-the-art AI powered solutions
 * Continuously expand your skills and embrace new challenges and product opportunities
 * Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders across roles and levels, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment
 * Be a self-motivated individual who is passionate about personal and professional growth
   
   

Technical Requirements


 * Strong full stack experience
 * Experience with AWS, React, Python, Lambda, Terraform technologies
 * Strong understanding of software development best practices
 * Strong understanding of Agile development methodologies
 * Experience supporting machine learning and data engineering into production
 * Strong ability to communicate effectively with cross functional team members, stakeholders and users
 * Strong ability to earn trust, push back effectively, and be open to constructive disagreement
   
   

Education & Experience


 * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field, or proven experience in the field
 * Minimum of 5 years of experience in software engineering and architecture, with a focus on cloud systems, user experiences, or data processing and handling, at scale
title: Full Stack Engineer - Brand

description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Software Engineering

Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Slack is looking for a Fullstack Senior Engineer to design and build features end to end and improve the performance and reliability of our systems at Quip to enable and help our largest and most engaged customers to collaborate and drive their business needs using Quip.

We build our app using reliable tools that our team knows and trusts, including Python, C++, Javascript/Typescript, Redis, and Linux. Additionally we have native client and desktop apps on iOS, Android, Windows, and Mac. Having general familiarity with any common programming languages (such as Java, Kotlin, Objective C) and distributed engineering concepts are huge pluses. We’re a collaborative team who genuinely enjoys working together with a cross-functional team of product managers, backend engineers, and full stack engineers to make Slack and Quip a better product. We are looking for engineers who are flexible with their technology choices but also understand that simplicity and reliability are aspects of a system to be carefully calculated with every decision made.

Background

Our goal at Quip is to build a productivity suite that every person at every company loves using every single day! Whether it’s Quip’s fundamental collaboration suite, or Quip for Sales, which brings our productivity suite directly into the CRM experience and enables our users to combine their unstructured day-to-day work with their line-of-business, structured responsibilities, we strive to make our customers more productive in their overall work life.

What you will be doing


 * You’re skilled in navigating ambiguity to deliver features to our customers by working closely with a cross-functional team that consists of Product Management, Design, Engineering, and Data Science.
 * You’re creative, flexible, and innovative; you’ll find ways to solve customer problems while balancing system maintainability to produce high quality results that have significant impact on our customers and Slack’s business.
 * You’ll actively own features or systems and define their long-term health, while also improving the health of surrounding systems.
 * You'll assist our skilled support team and operations team in triaging and resolving customer-facing production issues.
 * You'll mentor other engineers and deeply review code.
 * You’ll drive improvements in engineering standards, tooling, and processes
   
   

What You Should Have


 * You’ve been building and debugging complex web application systems in a team environment professionally for 6+ years.
 * You have expertise in functional or imperative programming languages -- e.g., PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, C, or Java. Python is a bonus!
 * You have experience in building complex layouts with CSS and HTML as well as some background in Javascript and modern browser technologies
 * You have strong UX and design sensibilities, and a desire to sweat the small stuff
 * You lead technical architecture discussions and drive technical decisions within your team.
 * You set the standard for writing understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability.
 * You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you.
 * You possess strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval.
 * You have a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience.
   
   

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.  * Someone who believes in exploring alternatives and quickly build prototyping to validate ideas and help iterate concepts
 * Someone who understands and believes in the core tenets of agile both in letter and spirit
 * 5 or more years of experience with developing modular, test first Angular, React or Vue applications
 * 3 or more years of experience working with Postgres, MySQL or MongoDB.
 * 5 or more years of solid hands-on experience building Node.JS applications.
 * 3 or more years of hands-on experience in using modern build tool chains and package managers (webpack, gulp, grunt, npm etc.)
 * Experience testing tools and frameworks like Jasmine, Protractor or similar.
 * Experience developing modern responsive web applications with HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, LESS, SASS, etc.
 * 2 or more years of experience working in agile environments with tools like Jira, Git, and Confluence.
 * Candidates with proven certifications and socially available profiles that demonstrate the body of work and participation in modern collaboration hubs.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Can demonstrate proficiency with Node JS eco-system
 * Can demonstrate proficiency with automated test tools
 * Can demonstrate proficiency with module Angular, React or Vue applications.
   
   

Public Trust Clearance

This role requires the hired candidate to go through public clearance. A minimum of 3 years of stay in the U.S. within the last 5 years is a must to be eligible to qualify for public trust clearance sponsorship.

Benefits And Perks


 *     65%-75% company sponsored (including dependents) premiums towards Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance. 100% employer sponsored STD, LTD & Life Insurance (min $100K). Voluntary Life insurance option available.
 *     Retirement 401(k) Plan with employer matching. Immediate vesting.
 *     Vacation & Sick leaves
 *     Discretionary Bonus, Spot awards, Gifts, Tenure based rewards.
 *     Company sponsored role based certifications/trainings.
 *     Monthly DoordashDashPass subscription.
 *     Group discounts via LifeMart ADP
   
   

Work Location

We do have great open collaboration physical office spaces in Leesburg VA and Baltimore MD for those of us that may prefer either short term or long-term physical spaces. However, Softrams is a 100% remote first team environment, and this role is a 100% remote opportunity within USA . Softrams works in eastern zone and standard work hours are 9 AM ET to 5 PM ET with flexibility around the start and end times based on the team needs.

About Softrams

Softrams is a Maryland & Virginia-based small business information technology, consulting, and solutions provider specializing in emerging technologies for UX/UI, Mobile Apps, DevOps, Big Data Analytics, Data Science, and Cyber Security. We offer innovative technology implementations and build customer-centric services that are simple, intuitive, scalable, efficient and most importantly usable.

Softrams is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, nation origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.
title: Senior Full Stack Developer

description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Software Engineering

Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Slack is looking for a Fullstack Staff Engineer to design and build features end to end and improve the performance and reliability of our systems at Quip to enable and help our largest and most engaged customers to collaborate and drive their business needs using Quip.

We build our app using reliable tools that our team knows and trusts, including Python, C++, Javascript/Typescript, Redis, and Linux. Additionally we have native client and desktop apps on iOS, Android, Windows, and Mac. Expertise in these areas and/or native clients is a huge plus, but having familiarity with other common programming languages (such as Java, Kotlin, Objective C) and distributed engineering concepts are fine substitutes. We’re a collaborative team who genuinely enjoys working together with a cross-functional team of product managers, backend engineers, and full stack engineers to make Slack and Quip a better product. We are looking for engineers who are flexible with their technology choices but also understand that simplicity and reliability are aspects of a system to be carefully calculated with every decision made.

Background

Our goal at Quip is to build a productivity suite that every person at every company loves using every single day! Whether it’s Quip’s fundamental collaboration suite, or Quip for Sales, which brings our productivity suite directly into the CRM experience and enables our users to combine their unstructured day-to-day work with their line-of-business, structured responsibilities, we strive to make our customers more productive in their overall work life.

What you will be doing


 * You’re skilled in navigating ambiguity to deliver features to our customers by working closely with a cross-functional team that consists of Product Management, Design, Engineering, and Data Science.
 * You’re creative, flexible, and innovative; you’ll find ways to solve customer problems while balancing system maintainability to produce high quality results that have significant impact on our customers and Slack’s business.
 * You’ll actively own features or systems and define their long-term health, while also improving the health of surrounding systems.
 * You'll assist our skilled support team and operations team in triaging and resolving customer-facing production issues.
 * You'll mentor other engineers and deeply review code.
 * You’ll drive improvements in engineering standards, tooling, and processes
   
   

What you should have


 * You’ve been building and debugging complex web application systems in a team environment professionally for 8+ years.
 * You have expertise in functional or imperative programming languages -- e.g., PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, C, or Java. Python is a bonus!
 * You have experience with native client programming – Objective C, Swift, Kotlin, Java, or C#
 * You have experience in building complex layouts with CSS and HTML as well as some background in Javascript and modern browser technologies
 * You have strong UX and design sensibilities, and a desire to sweat the small stuff
 * You lead technical architecture discussions and drive technical decisions within your team.
 * You set the standard for writing understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability.
 * You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you.
 * You possess strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval.
 * You have a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience.
   
   

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at www.equality.com and explore our company benefits at www.salesforcebenefits.com.

Salesforce is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.

﻿Salesforce welcomes all.

For Colorado-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $175,600 to $254,700.

Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.salesforcebenefits.com.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer

description:
Join a dynamic and collaborative team of software engineers and radiologists dedicated to revolutionizing AI in the field of radiology. Bring your expertise in software development to contribute to a meaningful cause.

Qualifications

4+ years of experience in full-stack web development

Proficiency in Typescript, Django, React, and Docker

Bonus points for experience in DICOM, medical devices, or 2D graphics programming

Must be fluent in English; US Citizenship or permanent residency required

Must be a resident of Alabama

Compensation And Benefits

Competitive salary ranging from $105k to $120k, depending on experience

401(k) eligibility after 6 months of employment

Health insurance stipend included

Generous leave policy: 4 weeks paid vacation and 8 paid holidays

Emphasis on work-life balance

Remote work flexibility within the state of Alabama

Flexible equipment budget for cutting-edge hardware

Freedom to choose your working schedule

Low meeting overhead to allow focus and productivity

How You Will Work

Collaborate with a remote team of skilled software engineers, an engineering product owner, and a visionary radiologist founder, alongside supporting radiologists at UAB.

Actively participate in requirements gathering and product ideation.

Engage in an iterative design and development process, witnessing the impact of your work on users and receiving direct feedback.

Work on interactive web frontends, data-driven backends, and AI projects.

Receive personalized 1-on-1 guidance from the team, fostering continuous learning and teaching opportunities.

Utilize a modern tech stack, including Docker, GitHub actions, a Git-driven quality management system, continuous integration, and a commitment to code quality.

Occasional travel to trade shows (approximately once a year) to showcase your contributions.

Choose your preferred tools, whether it's VS Code, Vim, Pycharm, Mac, Linux, or Windows.

Communication through Slack and Zoom, project management using GitHub Issues, cloud infrastructure on AWS, and ML with Tensorflow. Suggestions for process improvements are always welcomed.

Why work for us?

We've successfully navigated major funding and FDA regulatory clearance, setting us apart from other medical device startups.

We minimize regulatory burdens through the use of Git and automation, empowering engineers to drive the process.

Collaborate with a visionary radiologist who understands both patient needs and the preferences of healthcare professionals.

Remote work opportunities available.

Employment Type: Full-Time
title: Full Stack Developer (Typescript, Django, React, and Docker) - Remote | WFH

description:
Full Stack Engineer – Remote

We are a low-code / no-code interactive deep learning platform that allows collaboration between data science teams and subject matter experts within their own enterprise.

We are a deep tech company building large language models & machine learning systems.

Our company’s goal is to democratize access to machine learning and make the results easily accessible to people with no prior background in advanced statistics or natural language processing. Our motto is human perspective + machine > just the machine.

Who We Are

We are an MIT spinoff based in Arlington, Virginia, Brooklyn, New York and Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina. We are now a remote-first workforce. Our team is composed of machine learning hackers, full-stack engineers, and user-experience doyens. We value epic engineering, creativity, a high empathy work environment and in work-life balance.

Who You'll Do

We offer the opportunity to work with many exciting new technologies. Your time with us will be spent iterating on the following goals:


 * Writing performant code for handling trillions of data points
 * Ship clean and elegant user interfaces
 * Building high-performance horizontally scalable machine learning architecture
 * Implementing and championing best practices and principles for test automation & micro services initiatives.
 * Writing compact performant data structure
 * Crafting elegant, scalable web-services
 * Defining and optimizing our cloud & on-premise infrastructure
 * Embracing continuous integration & DevOps best practices
 * Working on a small team and helping where help is needed
 * Work on a variety of cutting-edge hardware accelerators for deep learning
   
   

Who You Are

You’re a passionate data centric software engineer who has experience working directly with product owners to deliver on both architectural & feature roadmaps. You are passionate to learn, eager to assume ownership of features and easy to collaborate with.

You have a love for both user-centric design and highly performant large data systems. You work hand in hand with deep learning and DevOps engineers to build state-of-the-art interactive AI experiences. You’re comfortable working in an un-siloed company and interacting with non-technical stakeholders.

Requirements


 * 2+ years of professional backend development experience
 * 2+ years of professional front end development experience
 * Fluent in Javascript / Typescript & Python
 * Experience building and maintaining distributed micro services; debugging & monitoring live production environments, including experience with Docker
 * Examples of clean code you’ve written filled with great design-patterns and a track record of working with numerous modern development frameworks
 * Comfortable working at a venture-backed startup
 * B.S., or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
   
   

Our Stacks

❖ Storage: PostgreSQL / Elasticsearch / Vector Databases

❖ Languages: TypeScript and Python

❖ Frameworks: Express, Angular, RxJS, Ray, Arrow

❖ MicroServices / Continuous Deployment

❖ Orchestration: Docker & Kubernetes

❖ On-Premise / AWS / GCP

Additional Information

We are proud to be an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer and encourages all applicants regardless of race, sex, gender identity, age, disability, religion, national origin, veteran status or sexual orientation. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion.
